summary: Expand ZIZO to include a full TikTok-style comments system (backend-persisted, visible to all users, supporting rich content) and a full share feature with per-post unique shareable links that deep-link into the app by opening the main feed and auto-scrolling to the linked post.
architectural_notes: Target platform is web (React) rather than Expo/React Native.
Core experience: vertical, full-screen, swipe/scroll paging video feed (TikTok-style).
Backend should be implemented as a canister (for the like API and feed metadata).
Search must query across both captions and creator handles and return mixed media (video+image) results.
Implement in-browser media capture and editing (camera access + client-side crop/trim/text/filters) for upload flow.
Security flow includes risk-triggered PIN challenge plus security questions and device confirmation; no email-based verification.
Add a visible in-app PWA install entry point: an “Install/Download App” button inside the Settings menu in the top bar.
Add user account settings UI/flow to update profile fields plus credential changes (PIN/password) and identifiers (username/handle).
APK/Play Store distribution can be achieved by wrapping the PWA (e.g., Bubblewrap/PWABuilder); requires store listing assets (icons/screenshots) and stable public app URL.
APK/PWA wrappers will only work if the deployed public app URL loads correctly in a normal browser; resolve any canister routing/asset serving issues before generating an APK.
known_issues: Uploads provide no success/progress feedback and uploaded posts are not visible after uploading.
Feed can appear completely empty (no older posts displayed), indicating a feed loading/fetch/rendering failure.
Build/implementation attempt failed ("AI couldn't implement that"), blocking generation of a public app link/APK until a successful build completes.
Deployed public app URL (icp0) fails to load (blank / "Canister ID Not Resolved"), causing APK wrappers to show only the link/ads instead of the app/login.
Frontend production HTML is referencing /src/main.tsx (source entry) instead of the built Vite bundle, preventing the app from loading on the icp0 URL.

Accessing the deployed icp0 URL returns: "The gateway couldn't determine the destination canister for this request. Ensure the request includes a valid canister ID or uses a recognized domain" (frontend canister routing/asset serving still failing).
Caption is currently required on upload; it should be optional.
Uploaded videos have no audio track after upload even though originals contain audio.
All uploaded videos freeze part-way through playback and won’t replay/continue.
Comment and Share buttons currently show a "Coming soon" placeholder for all posts; real comments + share flows are not implemented.

existing_features.title: Create a full-screen, vertically paged video feed UI (one video per screen) that works in modern desktop and mobile browsers, using scroll-snap or equivalent so each swipe/scroll lands on the next/previous video.

Implement video playback behavior similar to TikTok: only the currently active (in-view) video should play automatically; all other videos must be paused. Videos should be muted by default, loop, and load efficiently (avoid downloading all videos at once).

Add per-video overlay UI elements: creator handle, caption text, and an interaction rail (Like button + like count, optional Comment placeholder button, Share placeholder button). Add double-click/double-tap on the video area to like.
Add a simple playback speed control for the active video (e.g., 0.5× / 1× / 2×), accessible from the overlay UI, and apply it to the HTML video playback rate.

Implement a minimal backend API to supply the feed and persist likes: store a list of video metadata (id, videoUrl, handle, caption, likeCount) and expose endpoints to (1) fetch feed items and (2) toggle like for a given video for the current user identity.
Add a coherent, distinctive visual theme for a TikTok-like dark feed experience (colors, typography, spacing, and button styling) and apply it consistently across the feed UI.

Add a frontend upload entry point (upload button) that is visible on both mobile and desktop, allowing authenticated users to upload videos and pictures with a caption; after upload completes, the new post appears immediately in the global feed.
Update the feed rendering to support both video posts and image posts in the same vertically paged, full-screen feed, preserving existing overlays and interaction rail behaviors where applicable.

Add a mobile-app-like experience for the web app by enabling installability as a PWA and ensuring the UI feels app-like on mobile (safe-area spacing, full-screen layout stability, and touch-first controls).

Fix the feed sometimes rendering as completely empty by making feed loading resilient and diagnosable: ensure the app always attempts to fetch `fetchFeedItems()` when an actor is available (anonymous or authenticated), and surface actionable error details (without exposing sensitive data) when the fetch fails.
Improve upload UX so users always receive clear progress + completion feedback and their new post becomes visible immediately after upload succeeds.
Add keyword search for both videos and images across captions and creator handles, accessible via a Search button in the main top bar.
Add in-app capture for live video recording directly inside the app using the device camera, integrated into the existing upload flow.
Add basic editing tools for images and videos: image cropping, video trimming, text overlays, and simple filters, applied before upload.

Implement a simplified in-app three-step security verification (without email): security questions, device confirmation, and a PIN challenge that is triggered when the system detects suspicious activity.
Add the ability for users to download media (images/videos) from the feed directly to their device local storage.
Identify and fix any build-blocking issues so the project compiles, deploys, and serves the web app successfully (frontend + backend).
After a successful build, ensure the deployed app provides an accessible public app URL that can be shared with users (so it can later be wrapped into an APK if desired).

Rebuild and redeploy the full application (frontend + backend) so the deployed icp0 URL serves the React app correctly (HTML + bundled JS/CSS) and does not show a blank page, a raw link page, or “Canister ID Not Resolved”.

Fix any build/deploy configuration issues that could cause the production deployment to reference source-only entrypoints or missing static assets (e.g., ensure the production build serves bundled assets rather than relying on /src/* paths).
Update the PWA service worker caching logic to avoid serving stale/incorrect app shells or interfering with canister traffic on icp0 domains; ensure users get the latest build after redeploy.
After the successful rebuild/redeploy, provide the new working public app URL (icp0) that can be used for PWA-to-APK wrapping.

Fix the production frontend entry so the deployed ICP frontend canister serves the compiled Vite output (bundled JS/CSS from `dist/assets/*`) instead of referencing the source entry `/src/main.tsx` in production.

Update the frontend build/deploy configuration so the frontend canister uploads/serves the Vite build output directory (e.g., `frontend/dist`) as static assets during `dfx deploy`, ensuring the runtime files match what `npm run build` produces.

Fix the production frontend entrypoint so the deployed frontend canister serves the built Vite app shell (dist/index.html + dist/assets/*) instead of referencing the source module entry `/src/main.tsx`, which currently causes the icp0 URL to show “Canister ID Not Resolved”.

Ensure the frontend deploy configuration publishes the Vite build output directory (`frontend/dist/`) as the frontend canister’s static asset source so production never serves source-only paths like `/src/*`.

Update the production frontend deployment configuration so the frontend canister serves the Vite build output directory (`frontend/dist/`) as static assets, rather than serving source-only paths (e.g., `/src/*`). This must ensure the icp0 gateway can resolve the canister and load the app from `/`.

Ensure the production app shell is built correctly: the deployed `dist/index.html` must reference bundled assets under `/assets/*` and must not reference the development entrypoint `/src/main.tsx`. Align the build/deploy flow with the guidance in `frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md` and the template in `frontend/deploy/dfx-frontend-canister-assets.template.json`.

Add or update deployment-time verification so a deploy fails fast if `frontend/dist/` is missing or if `dist/index.html` still references `/src/main.tsx`, using the existing `frontend/scripts/verify-dist-shell.ts` checks as the gate before deploying the frontend canister.
Make the upload caption optional (uploader may leave it empty) while keeping the upload flow functional for both images and videos.
Fix the media editing pipeline so video edits do not convert the uploaded video into a JPEG/image and do not strip audio; edited videos must remain valid playable video files.
Add an in-feed pause/resume control on the video overlay so users can manually pause and resume the currently active video.
Ensure uploaded videos can play with sound (not permanently silent): provide a user-facing unmute/mute control for the active video and ensure the video element can output audio when unmuted.

Replace the current "Comments coming soon!" placeholder with a TikTok-style comments screen that opens from the feed (bottom sheet style), displays the comment list for the selected post, and allows authenticated users to add a new comment with optional media attachment (image/video).
Implement per-post shareable links that include the post ID and, when opened, load the main feed and automatically scroll to the referenced post.
Replace the current "Share feature coming soon!" placeholder with a functional share flow that supports copying the per-post link and, where available, invoking the native share sheet.

Fix the production frontend deployment so the frontend canister serves the Vite production build output (frontend/dist) as static assets, ensuring the deployed icp0 URL loads the React app successfully and does not reference development-only paths like /src/main.tsx.

Ensure the production deploy flow fails fast if the build output is not production-ready by running the existing frontend verification checks before deploying the frontend canister, and by ensuring the checks correctly validate that dist/index.html does not reference /src/main.tsx and that required static files are present.

After a successful rebuild and redeploy of both backend and frontend, provide the working public app URL in the exact format https://<your-frontend-canister-id>.icp0.io so the user can use it for PWA-to-APK wrapping.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement a simplified TikTok-style vertical video feed for the browser (web app UI/flow).
Add an advanced version including overlays + like API backed by a backend canister.
Create a mobile app form of the product (mobile-first, app-like experience rather than only a browser web app).
Add user uploads for videos and pictures: provide an upload button on both mobile and desktop, and publish uploads immediately into the global feed for everyone.
Update the backend data model and APIs to support user-generated uploads (both videos and pictures) that appear immediately in the global feed for everyone.
Remove the current admin-only restriction for adding content to the feed, replacing it with: any authenticated user can upload media (video or image) into the global feed; guests cannot upload.
If backend state shape must change to support mixed media feed items, add a conditional Motoko migration that preserves existing stored feed items and like counts during upgrade.
Add a search button/flow to search across creator handles and captions for both video and image posts (keyword-based).
Add in-app capture and editing tools: record live video in-app via device camera; basic editing for images/videos (crop, trim, text overlays, filters) before/after upload.
Add three-step security verification (without email): security questions + device confirmation + PIN challenge triggered when suspicious activity is detected.
Allow users to download media (images/videos) from the app directly to their device local storage.
Add a clear “Download/Install App” PWA install button placed in the top bar inside the Settings menu panel.
Add account management in Settings: allow users to edit their profile anytime, change PIN/password, change username, and change handle.
Support distributing the PWA as an Android APK / Play Store-ready package (via PWA wrapping such as Bubblewrap/PWABuilder) and define required store assets/steps.
Make the caption field optional during upload (uploader can leave it empty).
Fix uploaded videos losing audio tracks after upload (original files have sound, but playback has no audio).
Fix uploaded videos freezing part-way through playback (happens for every uploaded video).
Add pause/resume controls (buttons) on the in-feed video player overlay.
Update the backend addMedia API behavior to accept empty captions (store empty string) so optional captions do not cause backend errors or traps.
Re-run the full build and deployment so the updated frontend and backend are compiled and the deployed app reflects the fixes.

Implement a full TikTok-style comments feature: open a comment screen, list comments, allow adding comments; store comments in the backend so all users can see them; support text, emojis, stickers, mentions, and media (images/videos).

Implement Share for posts: each post has a unique shareable link; opening the link should open the main feed and auto-scroll/deep-link to the specific post; support copy link and (where available) native share sheet/in-app share options.

Implement a backend-persisted comments system for feed posts: store comments per feed item so that all users can fetch and view them, and authenticated users can add new comments (support text plus optional attached media: image/video).
Rebuild and redeploy both backend and frontend so the production deployment generates a working public ICP URL and the app loads successfully from the frontend canister.

Fix the frontend production asset serving so the deployed frontend canister serves the Vite production build output (frontend/dist) instead of source files, ensuring the deployed app shell does not reference the development entrypoint /src/main.tsx.
Make the deploy fail fast when the frontend build output is not production-ready by running the existing frontend verification scripts as a required gate before deploying the frontend canister.
After the successful rebuild and redeploy, provide the working public app URL in the exact format https://<your-frontend-canister-id>.icp0.io.
